Useful Sites for Crypto

  • BIU Cyber Center
    Welcome to the Bar-Ilan Center for Research in Applied Cryptography and Cyber Security.

  • Simons Institute for the Theory of Computing
    The world’s leading venue for collaborative research in theoretical computer science.

  • International Association for Cryptologic Research (IACR)
    A non-profit organization devoted to supporting the promotion of the science of cryptology.

  • Zero-Knowledge Proofs
    Information about zero-knowledge proofs, how they work, and their speed.

  • Blog about Crypto
    Personal homepages of cryptography professionals.

Blog about Crypto

Personal homepages of cryptography professionals.

  • Geoffroy Couteau
    CNRS research scientist at IRIF, Université Paris Cité. Link

  • Divesh Aggarwal
    Associate Professor in the Department of Computer Science at NUS. Link

  • Shweta Agrawal
    Research interests in cryptography, information security, and generally, theoretical computer science. Link

  • Daniele Micciancio
    Professor in the Computer Science & Engineering department at [the University of California, San Diego]. Member of Cryptography and Security group and Theory of Computation group. Link

  • Damien Stehlé
    Interests in cryptography, computational number theory, and [computer algebra]. Link

  • Vinod Vaikuntanathan
    [Professor at MIT EECS]. Link

  • Noah Stephens-Davidowitz
    Assistant Professor in [Cornell’s computer science department], and a member of the applied math field and the mathematics field. Link

  • Oded Regev
    Contributions to lattice-based cryptography and specifically the Learning With Errors problem, forming the basis of [post-quantum cryptography]. Link.

  • Fuchun Guo
    Dr. Fuchun Guo is currently an Associate Professor at [the School of Computing and Information Technology, University of Wollongong]. Link

  • Chris Peikert
    Research interests include cryptography, lattices, coding theory, algorithms, and [computational complexity]. Link

  • Alessandro Chiesa
    Associate Professor in [the School of Computer and Communication Sciences at EPFL]. Link

Crypto Courses

  • Zero-Knowledge Proofs
    Class aiming to bring together students and experts to explore Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZKP).

  • Illinois/cs598
    Course covering secure communication (encryption and authentication).

  • EECS 598–Lattices in Cryptography (2015)
    Course by Chris Peikert on lattices in cryptography.

  • CSE206A–Lattices Algorithms and Applications
    Course (Spring 2014) by Daniele Micciancio on lattice algorithms and applications.

  • CSE206A–Lattices Algorithms and Applications
    Course (Fall 2021) by Daniele Micciancio on lattice algorithms and applications.

  • CS 294-168 Lattices, Learning with Errors and Post-Quantum Cryptography
    Course by Vinod Vaikuntanathan on lattices, learning with errors, and post-quantum cryptography.

  • Lattices in Computer Science
    Course focusing on lattices in computer science.
